tasks.title: Set up core application structure and routing
tasks.description: Establish the foundational application architecture including routing, basic layout components, and navigation structure. This provides the skeleton that all other features will be built upon.
tasks.featureContext: Foundation needed before any task management features can be implemented
riskFlags: Architecture decisions will impact entire project
acceptanceCriteria: Application loads with proper routing configuration
Basic navigation between main views works
Responsive layout container is established

tasks.title: Design and implement task data model
tasks.description: Create the core task data structure with all necessary fields including id, title, description, status, priority, due date, category, and timestamps. This model serves as the foundation for all task-related functionality.
tasks.featureContext: Core data structure needed for storing and manipulating tasks
riskFlags: Schema changes later will require migration
acceptanceCriteria: Task object includes all required fields with proper types
Data validation rules are implemented
Default values are properly set for new tasks

tasks.title: Implement local storage persistence layer
tasks.description: Build the data persistence system using browser local storage to save and retrieve tasks. This ensures user data persists between sessions without requiring a backend initially.
tasks.featureContext: Data persistence is essential for a functional task tracker
riskFlags: Local storage size limits
Data loss if storage is cleared
acceptanceCriteria: Tasks are automatically saved when created/modified
Tasks persist after browser refresh/restart
Storage handles array of tasks with proper serialization

tasks.title: Build task creation form component
tasks.description: Create a comprehensive form allowing users to input task details including title, description, priority level, due date, and category. The form should be intuitive and provide immediate feedback for validation errors.
tasks.featureContext: Primary interface for users to capture new tasks
riskFlags: Form complexity may impact user experience
acceptanceCriteria: User can enter all task fields with appropriate input types
Form validates required fields before submission
Form resets after successful task creation
Visual feedback shows form submission status
edgeCasesToHandle: Form submission with empty required fields

tasks.title: Implement core task management operations
tasks.description: Build the business logic for creating, updating, and deleting tasks. This includes validation, state management, and coordination with the storage layer to ensure data consistency.
tasks.featureContext: Core operations that enable basic task management functionality
riskFlags: Data consistency issues
Race conditions in updates
acceptanceCriteria: Tasks can be created with validation
Existing tasks can be updated with all fields
Tasks can be deleted with confirmation
All operations update storage and UI consistently

tasks.title: Create basic task list display component
tasks.description: Build a simple list view to display tasks with essential information visible. This provides users with their first view of created tasks and establishes the foundation for more advanced list features.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to see their tasks after creating them
riskFlags: Performance with large task lists
acceptanceCriteria: Tasks display in a clean, readable list format
Essential task information is visible without scrolling
Empty state shows appropriate message
List updates immediately when tasks change
edgeCasesToHandle: Very long task titles or descriptions

tasks.title: Build task editing functionality
tasks.description: Enable users to modify existing tasks by clicking into edit mode or opening an edit modal. Users should be able to update any field and see changes reflected immediately in the task list.
tasks.featureContext: Users need ability to modify tasks after creation
riskFlags: Complex state management for inline editing
acceptanceCriteria: User can click to enter edit mode for any task
All task fields are editable with proper validation
Changes are saved automatically or with save button
Edit mode can be cancelled without saving changes

tasks.title: Implement task status management system
tasks.description: Create the logic and UI for managing task status changes between pending, in-progress, and completed states. Include visual indicators and status transition controls that are intuitive and responsive.
tasks.featureContext: Core feature for tracking task progress and completion
riskFlags: State transitions need clear business rules
acceptanceCriteria: Tasks can be marked as pending, in-progress, or completed
Status changes update storage and UI immediately
Visual indicators clearly show current status
Status transitions are logical and intuitive

tasks.title: Design and implement completion tracking UI
tasks.description: Build visual components for task completion including checkboxes, progress indicators, and completion animations. The interface should provide satisfying feedback when tasks are completed to encourage continued use.
tasks.featureContext: Visual feedback is crucial for user engagement and satisfaction
riskFlags: Animations may impact performance
acceptanceCriteria: Clear visual indicators for each task status
Smooth animations when status changes
Accessible design for users with disabilities
Consistent visual language across all status states

tasks.title: Create category management system
tasks.description: Build functionality for users to create, edit, and delete custom categories for task organization. Include color-coding capabilities and ensure categories can be easily assigned to tasks during creation and editing.
tasks.featureContext: Organization is key to managing larger numbers of tasks effectively
riskFlags: Category deletion with existing tasks needs handling
acceptanceCriteria: Users can create custom categories with names and colors
Categories can be edited and deleted
Categories persist in storage
Default categories are available for new users

tasks.title: Build category assignment and filtering interface
tasks.description: Create UI components that allow users to assign categories to tasks and filter their task list by category. Include color-coded visual indicators and an intuitive category selection interface.
tasks.featureContext: Visual organization helps users quickly identify and focus on relevant tasks
riskFlags: Complex filtering logic may impact performance
acceptanceCriteria: Categories display with consistent color coding
Users can filter tasks by single or multiple categories
Category assignment is intuitive during task creation/editing
Clear indication when no tasks match current filter
edgeCasesToHandle: Category deleted while filter is active

tasks.title: Implement due date setting and validation
tasks.description: Build date picker components and validation logic for setting task due dates. Ensure dates are properly formatted, stored, and validated against business rules like not allowing past dates for new tasks.
tasks.featureContext: Due dates are essential for prioritizing tasks and meeting deadlines
riskFlags: Date handling across timezones
Date format inconsistencies
acceptanceCriteria: Users can set due dates using intuitive date picker
Date validation prevents invalid entries
Due dates are properly stored and retrieved
Date formatting is consistent across the application
edgeCasesToHandle: Leap year and month-end edge cases

tasks.title: Create due date visualization and priority indicators
tasks.description: Build visual components that clearly indicate when tasks are overdue, due today, or approaching their deadline. Use color coding, icons, and sorting to help users quickly identify urgent tasks.
tasks.featureContext: Visual hierarchy helps users prioritize their work effectively
riskFlags: Color coding must be accessible to colorblind users
acceptanceCriteria: Overdue tasks are clearly highlighted
Due today tasks have distinct visual treatment
Upcoming deadlines show appropriate urgency indicators
Visual indicators work for users with accessibility needs

tasks.title: Build task search functionality
tasks.description: Implement search capability that allows users to find tasks by title, description, or category. The search should be fast, provide instant results as user types, and handle partial matches intelligently.
tasks.featureContext: Search becomes critical as users accumulate more tasks over time
riskFlags: Search performance with large task sets
acceptanceCriteria: Search returns relevant tasks based on title and description
Search results update in real-time as user types
Search handles partial matches and common typos
Search performance remains fast with large task lists

tasks.title: Implement advanced filtering system
tasks.description: Create comprehensive filtering options allowing users to combine multiple criteria such as status, category, due date, and priority level. Include preset filters for common scenarios like 'Due Today' or 'High Priority'.
tasks.featureContext: Advanced filtering helps users focus on relevant subsets of their tasks
riskFlags: Complex filter combinations may cause performance issues
acceptanceCriteria: Users can apply multiple filters simultaneously
Preset filter options are available for common scenarios
Filter state is preserved during session
Clear indication when filters are active
edgeCasesToHandle: Filter state management during task updates

tasks.title: Design search and filter user interface
tasks.description: Build an intuitive interface that combines search and filtering capabilities. Include clear visual indicators for active filters, easy ways to clear or modify search criteria, and smooth interactions between search and filter functions.
tasks.featureContext: User interface must make powerful search/filter features accessible and easy to use
riskFlags: Complex UI may overwhelm users
acceptanceCriteria: Search bar is prominent and easy to access
Filter options are organized and clearly labeled
Active filters are visually indicated with easy removal
Search and filter work together seamlessly
edgeCasesToHandle: State management during rapid filter changes

tasks.title: Build task sorting and organization features
tasks.description: Implement multiple sorting options for the task list including by due date, priority, creation date, and alphabetical order. Allow users to save their preferred sorting method and provide drag-and-drop reordering for manual organization.
tasks.featureContext: Proper sorting helps users prioritize and organize their workflow
riskFlags: Drag-and-drop may be complex on mobile devices
acceptanceCriteria: Tasks can be sorted by multiple criteria
Sort preference is remembered between sessions
Drag-and-drop reordering works smoothly
Sort indicators are clear to users
edgeCasesToHandle: Sorting tasks with null due dates
Maintaining custom order after task updates

tasks.title: Implement bulk task operations
tasks.description: Allow users to select multiple tasks and perform batch operations like marking as complete, changing category, setting due dates, or deleting. This feature improves efficiency when managing large numbers of tasks.
tasks.featureContext: Bulk operations improve efficiency for users with many tasks
riskFlags: Complex state management for multi-selection
acceptanceCriteria: Users can select multiple tasks with checkboxes
Bulk operations apply to all selected tasks
Clear feedback shows operation progress and results
Operations can be undone if mistakes are made
edgeCasesToHandle: Operations on tasks that become invalid

tasks.title: Add task completion history and archiving
tasks.description: Create a system to maintain completed task history while keeping the main view clean. Users can archive completed tasks and access them through a separate view, providing a sense of accomplishment without clutter.
tasks.featureContext: Historical view provides motivation and prevents main list from becoming cluttered
riskFlags: Storage size may grow significantly over time
acceptanceCriteria: Completed tasks can be archived automatically or manually
Archived tasks are accessible through separate view
Archive can be searched and filtered
Tasks can be restored from archive if needed
edgeCasesToHandle: Archive performance with thousands of completed tasks

tasks.title: Create productivity dashboard layout
tasks.description: Design and build a clean dashboard that displays key productivity metrics and task summaries. The dashboard should provide at-a-glance insights without overwhelming the user with too much data or complex visualizations.
tasks.featureContext: Dashboard provides users with motivation and insights into their productivity patterns
riskFlags: Dashboard layout must work on various screen sizes
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard shows key metrics in digestible format
Layout adapts to different screen sizes
Information hierarchy guides user attention appropriately
Dashboard loads quickly with minimal data processing
edgeCasesToHandle: New users with no task history
Users with very high or very low task volumes

tasks.title: Implement basic analytics and statistics
tasks.description: Build the calculation engine for productivity metrics including completion rates, average task completion time, streak tracking, and trend analysis. Focus on meaningful metrics that motivate users rather than overwhelming them with data.
tasks.featureContext: Analytics provide users with insights into their productivity patterns and motivation to improve
riskFlags: Complex calculations may impact performance
acceptanceCriteria: Accurate calculation of completion rates and trends
Performance metrics update in real-time
Statistics account for different time periods
Calculations handle edge cases gracefully
edgeCasesToHandle: Division by zero in rate calculations

tasks.title: Build data visualization components
tasks.description: Create simple charts and graphs to visualize productivity trends, completion rates, and task distribution by category. Keep visualizations clean and easy to understand, focusing on actionable insights rather than complex analytics.
tasks.featureContext: Visual representations make productivity data more engaging and easier to understand
riskFlags: Chart libraries may increase bundle size
acceptanceCriteria: Charts are responsive and work on all screen sizes
Visualizations update automatically when data changes
Charts are accessible to users with disabilities
Loading states show while charts are being generated
edgeCasesToHandle: Extreme values that break chart scaling

tasks.title: Optimize performance and conduct final testing
tasks.description: Conduct comprehensive testing across all features, optimize loading times and responsiveness, fix any remaining bugs, and ensure the application performs well with large datasets. Prepare the application for production deployment.
tasks.featureContext: Final optimization and testing ensures quality user experience at launch
riskFlags: Performance issues may require significant refactoring
acceptanceCriteria: Application loads within acceptable time limits
All features work consistently across supported browsers
Performance remains good with 1000+ tasks
No critical bugs remain in core functionality

cycles.name: Foundation
cycles.description: Core setup, data structures, and basic task management

cycles.name: Core Features
cycles.description: Essential functionality for task management and organization

cycles.name: Enhancement
cycles.description: Advanced features for filtering, search, and user experience
